newsitem.title: USA: Bridger 550 MW coal-fired unit restart delayed.
newsitem.headline: Bridger 550 MW coal-fired unit restart delayed.

text.p: Restart of the 550 megawatt (MW) unit 3 at the Jim Bridger coal-fired power plant in Wyoming has been delayed until at least Thursday, sources familiar with the plant's operations said Wednesday.
The unit, which was shut Friday for unplanned repairs, had been scheduled to restart Wednesday, but more problems with fans led to the delay, they said.
"It could be up for Thursday, but we are not scheduling for it," said one source.
Bridger's other three 550 MW units were said to be operating normally.

The Bridger plant is owned by PacifiCorp and Idaho Power Co, but officials at the companies do not comment on plant operations. ((--Los Angeles bureau + 1 213 955 6761)) Monday, 14 July 1997 15:36:22 ENDS nN14371780
